title: Groundhog Day 2017: What is Groundhog Day? Who is Punxsutawney Phil?
text:
Groundhog Day 2017: What is Groundhog Day? Who is Punxsutawney Phil? Groundhog Day 2017: What is Groundhog Day? Who is Punxsutawney Phil? GROUNDHOG Day is the US tradition that inspired Bill Murray’s hit 1993 movie, but what is it all about and who is Punxsutawney Phil? PUBLISHED: 09:08, Thu, Feb 2, 2017 | UPDATED: 09:24, Thu, Feb 2, 2017 GETTY Groundhog Day is the US tradition that inspired Bill Murray's hit film When is Groundhog Day 2017? 
People across the US are celebrating Groundhog Day today (February 2 ). What is Groundhog Day? 
Groundhog Day is a US tradition based on the idea that a groundhog can predict the date that spring will arrive. 
The tradition says that spring will come early if the groundhog emerges from its burrow on February 2 and the weather is cloudy. Related articles Celebrate Groundhog Day by watching Andie MacDowells' sexiest scenes 
If it is sunny the groundhog will see its own shadow and go back inside, and winter will continue for six more weeks. 
The custom began in Pennslyvania in 1887 when the editor of a local paper called the Punxsutawney Spirit named the town’s groundhog as the official Groundhog Day meteorologist. 
Since then a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil has given his forecast each February from the nearby town of Gobbler’s Knob.
